meanings.definition: Excessive or exaggerated alarm or panic.
meanings.sent1: The alarmism in the movie made me jump in my seat.
meanings.sent2: The news article was filled with alarmism about the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The alarmism in the haunted house was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: Her alarmism about spiders was as dramatic as a horror movie.
meanings.sent5: The alarmism in the emergency drill made it feel like a real disaster.

meanings.definition: The tendency to exaggerate or magnify potential dangers or threats.
meanings.sent1: His alarmism often leads to unnecessary worry.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was full of alarmism to sway voters.
meanings.sent3: The alarmism in the safety video was so over-the-top.
meanings.sent4: Her alarmism about the dark alley was like a scary story come to life.
meanings.sent5: The alarmism in the warning signs made me take extra precautions.

meanings.definition: The practice of spreading fear or anxiety about a particular issue.
meanings.sent1: The alarmism in the rumors caused unnecessary panic.
meanings.sent2: The activist's alarmism raised awareness but also caused stress.
meanings.sent3: The alarmism in the ghost story kept everyone on edge.
meanings.sent4: Her alarmism about the virus was like a contagious fear spreading.
meanings.sent5: The alarmism in the presentation made everyone feel uneasy.
